newsitem.title: ITALY: Rome hit by public transport strike.
newsitem.headline: Rome hit by public transport strike.

text.p: Traffic slowed to a crawl in Rome on Tuesday as a strike forced Romans who normally take public transport to use private cars or taxis.
The eight-hour strike by workers demanding a new contract halted most bus, tram and underground services. Some overland commuter rail lines were also affected.

Transport workers in the rest of Italy went on strike last week but Rome authorities asked local unions to postpone theirs so that it would not coincide with a visit by a committee due to rule on the capital's bid to host the 2004 Olympics.
On Wednesday city officials said most private traffic would be banned from the city centre because of high air pollution levels.
